com.camerontec.catalys.util.data

Class Decimal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.data.Decimal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Externalizable, Serializable, Cloneable, Comparable<Decimal>

    public class Decimal
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Comparable<Decimal>, Externalizable
    Representation of a floating point number as an int exponent and long mantissa. It is designed to be directly compatible with FAST decimal values.

    The value represented is mantissa * 10^exponent

    Note that differs in the following ways from the standard Java BigDecimal

    • By default it is not immutable - it can be changed. In fact, it is designed for reuse. However it can be set immutable by calling setReadOnly().
    • The maximum mantissa is limited to a "long" value - so the values it can hold are more limited than BigDecimal. The maximum value a Decimal object can hold is thus new Decimal(Long.MAX_VALUE, 0), or 9223372036854775807 [0x7fffffffffffffff].

    Care must be taken when using constructors and methods which take a maxDecimals parameter, for example: 

     double d = 9.223372036854775808;
 Decimal dec = new Decimal(d, 18);
 d = 1.0000000000000000001;
 dec = new Decimal(d, 19);

    Both these examples will throw an ArithmeticException because the normalized values cannot be represented with a long mantissa, even though the double values themselves are low.

    Author:
    John Cameron
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • add

        Returns a Decimal whose value is (this + other).

        A null other is treated as zero.

        Parameters:
        other - value to be added to this Decimal.
        Returns:
        this + other

      • add

        public Decimal add(Decimal other,
                   Decimal result)
        Returns a Decimal whose value is (this + other).

        A null other is treated as zero.

        The result is passed back in the given result object if it is not null. If it is null, a Decimal object is created.

        The purpose of this method is to allow control of object creation. If a non null result object is specified, no additional objects are created by this method.

        It also allows the object to modify itself by passing a reference to itself as the result parameter.

        Parameters:
        other - value to be added to this Decimal.
        result - the object in which the result is returned.
        Returns:
        this + other value passed back in the result parameter.

      • divide

        public Decimal divide(Decimal val,
                      int maxDecimals)
               throws ArithmeticException
        Returns a Decimal whose value is (this / val).

        A null val is treated as zero.

        Parameters:
        val - value by which this Decimal is to be divided.
        maxDecimals - Maximum number of decimal places
        Returns:
        this / val
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - val == 0 or val == null, or if the unscaled double result of the division is too big for the long mantissa to hold with the desired precision.

      • divide

        public Decimal divide(Decimal val,
                      int maxDecimals,
                      Decimal result)
               throws ArithmeticException
        Returns a Decimal whose value is (this / val).

        A null val is treated as zero.

        The result is passed back in the given result object if it is not null. If it is null, a Decimal object is created.

        The purpose of this method is to allow control of object creation. If a non null result object is specified, no additional objects are created by this method.

        It also allows the object to modify itself by passing a reference to itself as the result parameter.

        Parameters:
        val - value by which this Decimal is to be divided.
        maxDecimals - Maximum number of decimal places
        result - the object in which the result is returned.
        Returns:
        this / val value passed back in the result parameter.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - val == 0 or val == null, or if the unscaled double result of the division is too big for the long mantissa to hold with the desired precision.

        Returns:
        mantissa value matching targetExponent

      • getScaledMantissa

        public static long getScaledMantissa(Decimal dec,
                                     int targetExponent)
        Takes the mantissa and exponent of the given Decimal and returns the scaled mantissa value that would apply if the exponent was modified to the given targetExponent value.

        Note that this does not change the mantissa and exponent values of the Decimal object passed in.

        Scales the mantissa by changing its exponent, if possible.

        For example, the number 100 is expressed as:
        mantissa = 1, exponent = 2 in normalized form.

        You could use this method to change the exponent to 0, which would result in the representation changing to:
        mantissa = 100, exponent = 0.

        However, there are some exponent values that are not possible for a given decimal. For example, you could not encode the number 100 with an exponent of 3.

        Note that scaling an existing Decimal's exponent down is always possible because it just means multiplying the mantissa by some factor of 10. Scaling up is not always possible because that involves dividing the mantissa which may not result in a whole number.

        An attempt to set the new exponent to an impossible value will result in a IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        dec - Decimal whose original mantissa and exponent are to be used.
        targetExponent - Requested exponent
        Returns:
        mantissa value matching targetExponent
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the exponent is unsuitable.

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        True if value cannot be changed. Defaults to false.
        Returns:
        True if value cannot be changed.

      • multiply

        public Decimal multiply(Decimal other,
                        Decimal result)
        Returns a Decimal whose value is (this * other).

        A null other is treated as zero.

        The result is passed back in the given result object if it is not null. If it is null, a Decimal object is created.

        The purpose of this method is to allow control of object creation. If a non null result object is specified, no additional objects are created by this method.

        It also allows the object to modify itself by passing a reference to itself as the result parameter.

        Parameters:
        other - value to be multiplied by this Decimal.
        result - the object in which the result is returned.
        Returns:
        this * other value passed back in the result parameter.

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Convert mantissa and exponent to normalized form.

        "A decimal value is normalized by adjusting the mantissa and exponent so that the integer remainder after dividing the mantissa by 10 is not zero: mant % 10 != 0. For example 100 * 10^0 would be normalized as 1 * 10^2. If the mantissa is zero, the normalized decimal has a zero mantissa and a zero exponent."

      • scale

        public void scale(int newExponent)
        Changes the exponent to the given newExponent, scaling the mantissa accordingly.

        Note that the actual value represented does not change.

        Uses getScaledMantissa(int) to do the scaling.

        Parameters:
        newExponent - Desired new exponent.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the exponent is unsuitable.

      • setExponent

        public void setExponent(int exponent)
        Sets exponent of this value directly.

        Note that this will change the value of this Decimal. If you want to express the existing value with a different exponent (and therefore a correspondingly modified mantissa) you should use scale(int).

        Parameters:
        exponent - New exponent
        See Also:
        scale(int)

      • setMantissa

        public void setMantissa(long mantissa)
        Sets mantissa of this value directly.

        Note that this will change the value of this Decimal.

        Parameters:
        mantissa - New mantissa

      • setMantissaExponent

        public void setMantissaExponent(long mantissa,
                                int exponent)
        Sets mantissa and exponent of this value directly.

        Note that this will change the value of this Decimal.

        Parameters:
        mantissa - New mantissa
        exponent - New exponent

      • setReadOnly

        public void setReadOnly()
        Note that there is no way to set readOnly false. readOnly defaults to false, but once it is set true it stays true.

        This allows us to guarantee that readOnly Decimal's stay immutable, allowing multiple references to a single instance, confident that the value can never change (as for String objects).
